title: Neurorights Policy Schema
description: Machine-enforceable neurorights constraints for Morpheus_Client. Defines forbidden modules, disallowed sanctions, minimum rights floor, and per-jurisdiction governance rules.

policy_id.description: Unique identifier for this neurorights policy (e.g., 'eu_neurorights_v1', 'chile_amendment_v1')

authority.description: Legal authority or source of this policy

jurisdiction.description: Geographic/legal jurisdictions where this policy applies

neurorights_floor.description: Non-negotiable cognitive liberty and mental autonomy guarantees

freedom_of_thought.description: No coercive alteration of beliefs, values, or subjective experience

mental_privacy.description: Prohibition on unauthorized monitoring or inference of inner mental states

psychological_integrity.description: Protection against non-consensual psychological or emotional manipulation

personal_identity.description: Right to maintain coherent sense of self; no identity fragmentation or overwrite

module_name.description: Name of the forbidden neural interface or augmentation

reason.description: Why this module is forbidden under this policy
examples: Violates freedom of thought; enables subconscious coercion
Breaches mental privacy; exports dream/non-volitional content
Enables automated neurodecisions without explicit consent per GDPR Article 22
Uses inner-state biomarkers as governance input, violating neurorights floor

legal_reference.description: Citation to law or regulation that forbids this module

forbidden_modules.description: Neural modules that must never be loaded or active under this policy

scope.description: At what scope is this forbidden

sanction_type.description: Type of penalty or control mechanism forbidden

reason.description: Why this sanction mechanism violates neurorights

contexts_affected.description: Contexts where this sanction is forbidden (e.g., employment, healthcare, benefits access)

disallowed_sanctions.description: Specific types of sanctions or control mechanisms that violate neurorights

enforcement_mechanism.description: How this right is enforced at the system level
examples: EVOLVE token required; cannot be delegated or transferred
Hard type-level constraint; cannot be disabled
Enclave-sealed; cannot be accessed by untrusted code

derogation_impossible.description: True if this right cannot be suspended or waived, even in emergencies

no_neural_inputs_for_governance.description: Critical invariant: No raw neural data (EEG, fMRI, neurochemical state) can be used as input to decision-making that affects governance, resource allocation, or access rights

no_score_from_inner_state.description: Corollary: No algorithms, AI models, or heuristics can convert inner-state biomarkers into scores for predicting behavior, risk, or eligibility

automated_neurodecisions_forbidden.description: If true, any decision with legal or significant personal effect cannot be made solely based on neural data; requires human review
automated_neurodecisions_forbidden.note: Mandated by GDPR Article 22 and EU AI Act Article 5 in certain jurisdictions

outer_domain_telemetry_only.description: System can collect aggregate physiological indices (HRV, inflammation markers, EEG load indices) but never raw inner-domain content (raw EEG, dream reports, inferred thoughts)

explicit_opt_in.description: Neural augmentation always requires explicit, informed, revocable consent

granular_consent.description: Consent can be given per-module, per-functionality, per-telemetry-scope

consent_revocation_immediate.description: User can revoke consent at any time; system must cease operation immediately

consent_not_continuous.description: Each significant operation (not each heartbeat) requires fresh consent token (EVOLVE)

consent_context_must_be_clear.description: Consent must explicitly state what data is collected, how it's used, who can access it

free.description: Consent is free from coercion, duress, or implicit pressure

prior.description: Consent is obtained before any operation; no retroactive approval

informed.description: Consent is based on complete, understandable information about risks and benefits

indigenous_context.description: If 'required', operations in Indigenous territories require community steward approval in addition to individual consent

community_veto_possible.description: If true, Indigenous community council can veto individual consent for territorial reasons

collect_only_necessary.description: Never collect data beyond what is necessary for stated purpose

retain_minimum_duration.description: Delete data as soon as purpose is fulfilled

aggregate_preferred.description: Use aggregate statistics instead of individual-level data whenever possible

anonymization_required.description: Any external sharing must be anonymized and irreversibly de-identified

algorithm_explainability.description: Any AI/ML model used for decisions must be explainable and auditable

audit_trail_public.description: User can access full audit history of their own data and decisions

bias_monitoring_required.description: System must continuously monitor for algorithmic bias in neural-based decisions

independent_review_available.description: User can request independent expert review of any neurorights decision

immediate_notification.description: User must be notified within 24 hours of any neurorights breach

escalation_to_regulator.description: Serious breaches must be reported to relevant regulatory authority

remediation_obligation.description: System operator must take steps to prevent recurrence and repair harm

no_suppression_of_reports.description: User cannot be coerced or penalized for reporting neurorights violations

implementation_notes.description: Optional implementation guidance for developers and operators

references.description: Citations to laws, regulations, and ethical frameworks
